alert.note: Alert for Bradford (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 2:24AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Bradford, Lackawanna, Luzerne, Susquehanna and Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 222 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving into the area early this morning. These downpours will cause urban and small stream flooding. Areas of Susquehanna and Wyoming counties hit with heavy rain last week will be especially vulnerable. - Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area in a short amount of time. This rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scranton, Carbondale, Towanda, Tunkhannock, Montrose, Wyalusing, Waverly, Falls, Archbald, Dickson City, Olyphant, Clarks Summit, Rush, Harveys Lake, Susquehanna, Forest City, Mayfield, Wysox, Susquehanna Depot and Springville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
